item.title: Mona add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Mona add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Mona add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Mona add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "I still remember the day my father took me to the Cemetery of Forgotten Books for the first time." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Mona add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "For you, a thousand times over" -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Mona add a quote by Leif Enger (So Brave, Young, and Handsome)
item.description: "....her life would be a giddy crossword, working down from some clues and across from others." -- Leif Enger (So Brave, Young, and Handsome)

item.title: Mona add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Mona add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Mona add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "People generally see what they look for, and hear what they listen for." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Mona add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Miss Jean Louise, stand up. Your father's passin'." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Mona add a quote by Pete Hamill
item.description: "The old women were gone. They seemed to have ascended into the darkness like the waxy smoke from the candles after he capped them with the brass bell at the end of the snuffer. For a moment, staring into the darkness, he imagined the rafters full of smoky old women with hair sprouting from their chins. Hundreds of them. Thousands. Whispering in Italian, and Polish, and Latin about dead husbands and dead children. Like angels grown old but not allowed to die. He could smell them: the odor of candles." -- Pete Hamill

item.title: Mona add a quote by Pete Hamill
item.description: "He tried to imagine the sound of the color red." -- Pete Hamill

item.title: Mona add a quote by David Guterson
item.description: "The snowfall obliterated the borders between the fields and made Kabuo Miyamoto's long-cherished seven acres indistinguishable from the land that surrounded them. All human claims to the landscape were superseded, made null and void by the snow. The world was one world, and the notion that a man might kill another over some small patch of it did not make sense." -- David Guterson

item.title: Mona add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Mona add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Mona add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Mona add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Mona add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Mona add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mona add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Mona add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Mona add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mona add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Mona add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Mona add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Mona add a quote by Gregory David Roberts
item.description: "Sometimes we love with nothing more than hope. Sometimes we cry with everything except tears." -- Gregory David Roberts

item.title: Mona add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Mona add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description:
"Well I see you there with the rose in your teeth One more thin gypsy thief Yes, and thanks, for the trouble you took from her eyes I thought it was there for good so I never tried.
And Jane came by with a lock of your hair She said that you gave it to her That night that you planned to go clear" -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Mona add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Mona add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West
